verses.verse: Then Job <WH347> answered, <WH6030>
"Oh <WH3863> that my vexation <WH9213> were actually <WH8254> weighed, <WH8254> And laid <WH5375> in the balances <WH3976> together <WH3162> with my iniquity! <WH1942>
"For then <WH6258> it would be heavier <WH3513> than <WH4480> the sand <WH2344> of the seas, <WH3220> Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> my words <WH1697> have been <WH9236> rash. <WH9236>

"For the arrows <WH2671> of the Almighty <WH7706> are within <WH5973> me; Their poison <WH2534> my spirit <WH7307> drinks; <WH8354> The terrors <WH1161> of God <WH433> are arrayed <WH6186> against me.
"Does the wild <WH6501> donkey <WH6501> bray <WH5101> over <WH5921> [his] grass, <WH1877> Or <WH518> does the ox <WH7794> low <WH1600> over <WH5921> his fodder <WH1098>?
"Can something <WH8602> tasteless <WH8602> be eaten <WH398> without <WH1097> salt, <WH4417> Or <WH518> is there <WH3426> any <WH3426> taste <WH2940> in the white <WH2495> of an egg <WH2495>?
"My soul <WH5315> refuses <WH3985> to touch <WH5060> [them;] They are like loathsome <WH1741> food <WH3899> to me.
"Oh <WH4310> <WH5414> that my request <WH7596> might come <WH935> to pass, <WH935> And that God <WH433> would grant <WH5414> my longing! <WH8615>
"Would that God <WH433> were willing <WH2974> to crush <WH1792> me; That He would loose <WH5425> His hand <WH3027> and cut <WH1214> me off! <WH1214>

"But it is still <WH5750> my consolation, <WH5165> And I rejoice <WH5539> in unsparing <WH3808> <WH2550> pain, <WH9133> That I have not denied <WH3582> the words <WH561> of the Holy <WH6918> One. <WH6918>
"What <WH4100> is my strength, <WH3581> that I should wait <WH3176>? And what <WH4100> is my end, <WH7093> that I should endure <WH748> <WH5315>?
"Is my strength <WH3581> the strength <WH3581> of stones, <WH68> Or <WH518> is my flesh <WH1320> bronze <WH5153>?
"Is it that my help <WH5833> is not within me, And that deliverance <WH8454> is driven <WH5080> from me?
"For the despairing <WH4523> man <WH4523> [there should be] kindness <WH2617> from his friend; <WH7453> Lest he forsake <WH5800> the fear <WH3374> of the Almighty. <WH7706>
"My brothers <WH251> have acted <WH898> deceitfully <WH898> like <WH3644> a wadi, <WH5158> Like the torrents <WH650> of wadis <WH5158> which vanish, <WH5674>
Which are turbid <WH6937> because <WH4480> of ice, <WH7140> [And] into which the snow <WH7950> melts. <WH5956>
"When <WH6256> they become <WH2215> waterless, <WH2215> they are silent, <WH6789> When it is hot, <WH2552> they vanish <WH1846> from their place. <WH4725>
"The paths <WH734> of their course <WH1870> wind <WH3943> along, <WH3943> They go <WH5927> up into nothing <WH8414> and perish.
"The caravans <WH734> of Tema <WH8485> looked, <WH5027> The travelers <WH1979> of Sheba <WH7614> hoped <WH6960> for them.
"They were disappointed <WH954> for they had trusted, <WH982> They came <WH935> there <WH5704> and were confounded. <WH2659>
"Indeed, <WH3588> you have now <WH6258> become <WH1961> such, <WH3808> You see <WH7200> a terror <WH2866> and are afraid. <WH3372>
"Have I said, <WH559> 'Give <WH3051> me [something,'] Or, 'Offer <WH7809> a bribe <WH7809> for me from your wealth, <WH3581>'
Or, 'Deliver <WH4422> me from the hand <WH3027> of the adversary, <WH6862>' Or, 'Redeem <WH6299> me from the hand <WH3027> of the tyrants <WH6184>'?
"Teach <WH3384> me, and I will be silent; <WH2790> And show <WH995> me how <WH4100> I have erred. <WH7686>
"How <WH4100> painful <WH4834> are honest <WH3476> words! <WH561> But what <WH4100> does your argument <WH3198> prove <WH3198>?
"Do you intend <WH2803> to reprove <WH3198> [my] words, <WH561> When the words <WH4405> of one in despair <WH2976> belong to the wind <WH7307>?
"You would even <WH637> cast <WH5307> [lots] for the orphans, <WH3490> And barter <WH3739> over <WH5921> your friend. <WH7453>
"And now <WH6258> please <WH2974> look <WH6437> at me, And [see] if <WH518> I lie <WH3576> to your face. <WH6440>
"Desist <WH7725> now, <WH4994> let there be no <WH408> injustice; <WH9390> Even desist, <WH7725> my righteousness <WH6664> is yet <WH5750> in it.
"Is there <WH3426> injustice <WH9390> on my tongue <WH3956>? Cannot <WH3808> my palate <WH2441> discern <WH995> calamities <WH1942>?
